column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: Sara, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After reading several reviews I noticed that many of the women who complained about Monistat 1 were first time users or had never had a yeast infection before. Unfortunately I suffer from frequent yeast infections, possibly due to genetics since my mom has the same issue, and although I have changed my diet and take extra good care of my lady parts, I still have problems. I've used Monistat 7 in the past but I decided to use the 1-day to save the aggravation of using the cream for 7 days. Like many women said in their reviews I did feel some burning and a warm sensation as the medicine began to work, however it was nothing compared to the discomfort of a yeast infection. I think that this product is definitely stronger than the 7-day formula and it does take some getting used to, but for women who have used over the counter yeast infection creams it really isn't anything different from the 7-day formula. Also, Vagisil helps a lot with the external itching since it tends to have a slight numbing effect that dulls the itching. I usually use both products together.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva

column9: I felt I needed to write a foil to all the negative reviews. I used Monistat 1 yesterday for my first yeast infection. I used it in the evening, so I went straight to bed after inserting it. I had a mild infection and this worked perfectly, so it CAN work, it just doesn't appear that it works positively for everyone.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've taken this in the past for a YI. My Trivora birth control has been giving me clock work YI and in the past Monostat 1 has worked. However, I used it this past week for a particularly bad YI. I experienced severe burning and abnormal spotting. I normally start my cycle on the 24-25th pill; I started spotting abnormally on the 20th pill. It cleared up my YI effectively but it left my skin irritated and caused abnormal spotting. After a few days, I had sex with my fiance and afterwards I experienced intense burning and discomfort (highly unusual for me). After inspection, I found that my vaginal skin was so irritated and inflamed that it even hurt to sit down. I'm completely upset by this abnormal reaction. I expected the medication to work like it has in the past; it did not.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: *WARNING* I have read several reviews and even with hesitation I still decided to take this medication. First and foremost I made it a point to come on here and leave this comment. Second I thought I was going to have to seek medical attention. I did not take the medication at bed time (thank god) because no one can sleep through that type of pain. I will say this I'm not prone to YI so I've come to the conclusion that my experience was so intense because I had a very mild YI so the Monistat 3 or 7 day might have been better. Now back to the pain.... I took the medication mid-day and within an hour I felt some discomfort, within the next two hours my pain was so intense I begin to lose feeling in my legs and I was unable to walk straight the only thing I could focus on was the fact that when I got home I would do all that was humanly possible to get the medicine out of my body. As the day went on and the expulsion of the medicine took place I started to feel some relief, my final thoughts on this product is this.... My YI was mild or better yet irrelevant compared to me using the Monistat 1 this medicine caused pain that I have never felt before and I would never wish that on my worst enemy. BUYER BEWARE

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: LON, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used monistat in the past before they had the one day dose and never had an issue. I hate to write just to complain, but people need to know there is something wrong with this product. Do not take the risk, just call your dr. After an hour from inserting the "pill" I had horrible itching, soreness, pain, and swelling that was WAY worse than the actual infection. I went online and started reading all the reviews, and how most women are reporting the same experience. I took a bath trying to get as much of that stuff out as I could. I feel better now but probably will still have issues until all the medicine comes out. I wish I would have read these reviews first. Just some advice if you do use it and have the same reaction- I read a review from a lady who said just to douche and get it out immediately and you should feel fine. I can't even walk right now, so I will not be making the drug store run tonight to get some, but I do feel most of the pain gone just from taking the bath and trying to rinse it out. I'm calling my gyn in the morning to get some pills! Hope this helps!

column9: This medication made my problems worse. I had increased itching and burning along with internal swelling. I found it difficult to stand or sit. column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: JA, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The rewards are NOT outweighing the benefits. I noticed the early signs of a YI and took this product thinking it would resolve the issue in one day. WRONG! I blame my ignorance/lack of research for not knowing this product is simply a one-dose treatment...not a quick-fix. I even took the product in the evening, so the morning after was fairly mild. Since then, I've felt a warm, thick, cottage cheese-like discharge constantly. My vaginal area is red and raw, with a thin waxy film over my labia. Other reviews indicate it may be too strong, so if I can warn even one other unsuspecting female who has the foresight to research before trying this product (unlike myself), then my only suggestion would be GO NATURAL. The last time I had a YI, I took the 7-day cream which was messy, but much more gentle and combined that with a cooling application of unflavored yogurt for my lady-parts. The symptoms were gone within 3 days (but you must continue) and the yogurt worked tremendously better than the chemical soaked external cream included in my torture pack. I have no choice but to ride this out, constantly remove gunk-like egg ovule discharge from "down there" and wait the seven days I would've been waiting either way. Convenience certainly came with a price! I'm not looking forward to future YI's but if it ever occurs again, I'm looking more into the ACV douches and Acidophilus as a remedy.

column9: I will admit that when I first inserted the ovule and within an hour afterwards my entire vaginal area was on FIRE.  However, after enduring about two to three hours of intense discomfort, I awoke refreshed and I have not itched or felt the usual yeast infection symptoms and I am now on day four.  So, I guess the discomfort was worth the pain for me.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Monistat 1 causes a major burning sensation. I inserted the ovule last night and then applied the external cream. My external vaginal area now burns much more than it did before any treatment. It's bothering me so much that I decided to Google "Does Monistat 1 work well." I wish I Googled that before I treated myself. I've come to learn that many, many women feel much worse after treatment than before - the burning is extremely uncomfortable. I've used Monistat 7 before and it worked great, but I decided to try Monistat 1 thinking it would cure me quicker. However, I've since learned that either way it takes about 7 days. It's too late for me to switch now - I just hope that by day 7 I'm cured. I wish I used Monistat 7 instead  - I remember the cream felt soothing (which is much better than Monistat 1's terrible burning).

Im still miserable and have to tough it out tonight, honestly not worth it, I shoudl of just went straight to the doctors instead of trying to deal with the pain :( im not having a goodnight at all. column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I self-diagnosed, based on many years' experience with occasional yeast infections.  I'd never used the 1-day before.  Within minutes of use, I was burning, inflamed, and scared that I'd done something horrible to myself!  The whole area, including my anus was swollen and stinging.  I don't recommend this to anyone, and don't think it should be sold over-the-counter!  I did try to sponge it off, and went to sleep.  When I woke up, the burning was mostly gone, but I still feel some, 12 hours later.  It remains to be seen whether it was effective in treating the problem.  I wish I had looked online at the comments BEFORE using it!

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 19-24 Female  (Patient)
column9: Had a YI after taking strong antibiotics, bought Monistat 1 b/c I thought it would be the most hassle-free of all the Monistats. Wish I never took it, I'd rather deal w/ the YI, which wasn't even bad to begin with. The YI was nothing compared to the pain I'm in from this med. I took the ovule at 1 AM on a Fri and Sat afternoon I began getting extreme itching and soon after extreme burning. my vagina feels sore and raw both the vulva and inside the vaginal canal. Now it hurts when I urinate as well. I tried my best to get the med out but it didn't work. I can't touch anywhere in my genital area without severe pain. I'd say this is an allergic reaction but it seems too many women are having these same symptoms for us all to be having reactions. I think its just a very higly concentrated dosage, the 7 day cream probably would have been a better bet. Scratching like a lunatic for days probably didn't help my skin's condition when it came time to insert the ovule either...maybe thats why some ppl don't seem to have such bad side effects, they don't scratch beforehand? All I know is I'm not being a baby, this is literally torture, I feel like I have vulvodynia (I hope not!). I hope this goes away b/c I don't think I can take it much longer. I have some slight swelling but its not too bad. It hurts to sit, walk, urinate, even if my legs are too close together. I have to sit with my legs wide open, lol. Never again.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: justme, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've decided to write a review since there are a lot of neg ones.  I'll be honest, when I first took this I didn't have the most pleasant experience and reading some reviews freaked me out.  Here's my history -- I was diagnosed with yeast infection last year by my obgyn of which she prescribed a one day oral medicine. It took a few days for it to work, but I don't recall having any side effects.  Now recently I've noticed symptoms again.  So I used Vagisil to diagnose myself and it seems my pH level was telling me I have yeast infection. So I decided to use Monistat 1 because it seems more convenient and I hate taking medicines. So here's my experience with Monistat 1 -- I used this on a Friday night and was able to sleep. The next day, I noticed every time I used the restroom I get a LOT white pastey discharge afterward (so wear a pad)!  I was also somewhat sore (vagina) after I used the restroom, to the point where I tried to avoid going because I didn't want to feel the pain and deal with the discharge. By Sat night, I was in a lot of pain down there and very sore -- a soreness I'm not used to feeling and it kinda swelled. Yet, I was able to suck it up and have a night in downtown.  I used the external cream twice that day.  On Sunday, I still get the white pastey discharge, but it wasn't nearly as much as on Sat.. by the end of Sunday it was nearly gone. The soreness was very little this time. And I noticed I've stopped itching for the most part and used the cream maybe twice again. On Monday, I was really itchy in the middle of the day but it suddenly stopped completely and I had very little white pastey discharge.  I used the itchiness only once in the morning since I didn't take it with me to work. On Tuesday, I still used the external cream in the morning in case, but didn't itch at all.  And since Tuesday, I feel normal.  My body appears normal.  Although my experience on Saturday was at times unbearable -- it all worked out for me in the end.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: noodle202, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I hope I provide some insight as I have a lot of experience: Used Monistat-1 Ovule three times, 1-pre filled applicator 2 times, 3 day creams 2 times... have had multiple yeast infections, diagnosed by doctors. Monistat-1 is a very concentrated, powerful dose. It does produce burning and swelling, but even the weaker creams have that effect to a point. And the more raw you are from the yeast to begin with, the stronger this reaction will feel. The first two times I used the ovule, it did feel intense for the first night, but quickly relieved the symptoms and did the job. This last time was four days ago... I'm not sure why this time was different for me, but I am convinced i suffered a chemical burn from this medication. The day of taking the med was fine, but the next day and for 3 days now I have been bleeding moderately. By that- I mean not as heavy as my normal peried but heavy enough that a panty liner isn't enough - I need an actual pad. There has been bits of tissue and skin in the blood.  Also, that next day, I was literally swollen shut and felt my heart beat pounding through that entire area... throbbing. I used cold packs. I will not say it was 'intolerable, i was crying/dying!' because I am too realistic for that. It was quite painful & I'm sure I've peeled off the top layer of inner vaginal skin, possibly my cervix. I hope there is no permanent damage. This is not safe or healthy in the least, don't use the 1 ovule unless you have a severe, thick cream discharge. I will never use this strong of a dose again, stick with 7 or 3 day creams.

column9: Well here's the thing...you have to make sure that what you have is actually a yeast infection!  I made the mistake of assuming that's what it was...because I had never heard of bacterial vaginosis.  I used monistat for three nights and it burned like crazy...I decided to stop using it and go to planned parenthood.  The clinician there thought I had herpes! She said she saw some blisters.... For Pete's sake! I was so confused....  when I went to another doctor she said that I had a bacterial infection but didn't see blisters.  I asked if it could have been the monistat that caused a reaction like that and she said yes.    By the way I was tested twice and I do not have any stds at all, including herpes...so all I know is that I used monistat and it gave me blisters, however they didn't see yeast when they examined me.  Of course after I used the anti bacterial I got a yeast infection but I used a prescription and it was much easier.  Use an anti fungal pill if you can...most creams burn you, though not as bad as monistat, and a pill can get rid of any yeast in your bum hole too.  Serious, yeast gets in there too ...  yeesh.

column2: Female  (Patient)
column9: Take this garbage off the market!! I used this for an OBVIOUS YI with classic symptoms due to taking antibiotics for a dental abcess. NO STDS, NO bacterial infection, no agressive or permiscuous sex, etc. 24 hrs later I am now swollen internally, burning internally & in more pain than before I used the product. column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: goawayitchiness , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It hasn't even been 24 hours and I'm already feeling some relief. The first thing you ladies need to understand is that a yeast infection is a FUNGUS, not bacterial (I'm not sure but it might be possible to have a fungal and bacterial infection at the same time...do your own research). I loled at some of these reviews because of that misunderstanding. Get your facts straight first. Now the only thing that I regret is not going to the doctor to figure out what strain of yeast this is. That is important to know. Another thing is make sure that it is a yeast infection and not an STD. If you're experiencing blood/blisters with the discharge, it could be an STD or you could be having an allergic reaction to this medicine. It hasn't cleared up for me yet (obviously cause it has only been approx. 24 hours), but I'm trying to be patient. It can take up to a week to clear up. Fortunately for me, this medication hasn't burned too bad at all. According to my symptoms this is the first yeast infection that I have ever had. My advice is if you experience YI symptoms, go to the doctor first if you can and ask them to figure out what strain it is so that the right medicine can be taken. I didn't know that before I bought Monistat 1 (I was feeling desperate and wanted to start treatment right away). Patience is key. So far so good. Good luck and get well soon!

I was contemplating going to the ER, but instead I jumped in the shower and doused my vayjayjay with ice cold water.  well that helped a little. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am plagued by yeast infections and have been for years.  I usually use Diflucan and find relief after 7 days, only to have them return every 3 months.  Once, I used the Monistat 7 day cream and it made my infection worse - burning, itching, painful mess and swore I would never use Monistat again.  However, I got a yeast infection when I was out of town and had no refills for a diflucan and couldn't see my doctor. Out of desperation I tried the Monistat 1 ovule instead of the cream and to my relief started feeling a little better after 3 days. Was still a little itchy on day 5 but the symptoms were definitely lessening. It's now the 7th day and I'm not having anymore symptoms (other than discolored discharge from the medicine I think which I hope goes away soon - having to wear pantyliners was a pain) so I hope the infection is completely gone. I also ate TONS of yogurt so that may have helped too. Normally my infections are severe but luckily this one was mild. I'm not sure if it's because of the medicine or what but I am proud and excited to say I think it worked!!  So I think the only way you'll ever know if Monistat works for you is to try the cream and the ovule because one worked for me, one didn't.  HOORAY for finding an OTC yeast infection cure!!!!!

column2: none,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So basically it's really easy to use - and by "use" i mean burn the crap out of your vagina! I can not believe that this is on the market. I haven't had a yeast infection in 8 or 9 years so was happy to see a 1 day option. But wow...I had to take a friggin' loratab to get the pain under control and thought I might end up in the ER. I wish I had read these reviews before. There should be some MAJOR warnings on this thing. Whomever is responsible ought to be ashamed.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: One evening I started to feel a little itching.  That next morning I picked up some monistat 1 from the pharmacy.  After I used the monistat 1 the feeling went from a little itching to severe burning way worse than any yeast infection I had ever had.  I used it during the day and hopefully that was smart because after the burning I wanted all of it to leak out ASAP. The next morning the burning was a little better but still there. I am waiting for it to go away. I called and got a prescription for an oral medication that actually treats the infection without the severe burning...would recommend calling a doctor to get that or using a monistat version that isn't as strong.  Never again.
